job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
Polco is looking to add an insightful, creative Software Engineer who wants to improve cities and communities by building great civic engagement software. We’re looking for a tenacious problem solver who loves a challenge and is excited by the pace of a startup.
Who we are
Polco is dedicated to transforming how local governments, representatives, and community organizations interact with the communities they serve. We’re all about civic engagement and creatively bringing new and innovative technologies to the front lines of democracy. Our team comes from every walk of life and all corners of the political spectrum, but we’re all problem solvers at heart. Polco is designed to bring people closer together regardless of who they are, where they come from, or how they think. We appreciate and celebrate these differences among our team, too. After all, we’re building something that everyone needs to love, so a broad range of diverse perspectives is important. We don’t look for people with perfect resumes or who “fit the mold.” We look for people who can make our team better.
The Job
As a developer at Polco, you'll jump right into the role, learning our stack and collaborating with other teams to deliver value to our users. We're looking for someone to quickly become an instrumental member not only of the development team but of the whole Polco team. You'll change, commit, and deploy code within days of starting (with guidance!). You'll work with the product, marketing, and sales teams to understand requirements and business value. Developers at Polco are generalists, and we often work both independently and in small teams, so you'll get to experience a wide variety of technologies and approaches.
Requirements
Technical
Be familiar with several programming languages and have in-depth experience with at least one.
Write clean, logical, high-quality code and adopt test-driven development and Agile practices.
Have a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, a related field, or professional industry experience.
Have an understanding of software development fundamentals.
Have experience with core web technologies (HTML, CSS, Javascript)
The candidate must reside in the US to be considered for this role.
Bonus points for
Typescript
Single-page application frameworks like React
GraphQL and Apollo
PostgreSQL
Automated testing
Mobile-first or responsive design
Data engineering and analytics
Heroku, or other cloud infrastructure services
Next steps
The next step would be to complete a project-based assessment on the Hatchways platform.
Why work with us?
We're on an awesome stack (https://stackshare.io/polco/polco)
The excitement of being in on the ground floor of a new startup
Competitive compensation and stock options
Benefits package including dental, medical, vision coverage
Flexible work hours, remote working and paid time off
Remote-friendly work environment
